text: BIODIVERSITY AND OPEN SPACE a. walkways and slipways for pedestrians, boaters and cyclists; b. bridges and tunnels (e.g. across the rivers Lea and Thames); c. water-based sport and leisure (e.g. sailing and kayaking); d. security and safety (e.g. lifebuoys and other life-saving equipment); e. water-based passengers, tourism, transport support and freight infrastructure (e.g. piers and clippers); f. marine support facilities; g. moorings (including permanent and visitor moorings) and their support infrastructure; and h. flood defences and their strengthening and raising in line with the TE2100 Plan.
